user_review: Super nice place! Its quiet and laid back with a great vibe. The drinks are yummy and the wine list is long. Go for a nice night and talk with friends. Very friendly waitstaff as well.

We really enjoyed the atmosphere here. We only had a drink each and shared an appetizer, but it was a really laid back and cool environment. The waitress was really friendly and helpful in giving us recommendations or guiding us through her favourites. If we weren't as hungry or were there for longer, we definitely would've ordered more. Definitely a place to check out!

I came here with girlfriends after dinner on a Saturday night. All the tables were taken but we sat at the bar a few minutes. Then we were able to grab a table.  The staff is knowledgeable and can give recommendations, although my friends didn't love the wine they got. I liked my cocktail though. It's more of a data spot, as groups are small and keep to themselves.

Bar Henrietta is a hot spot in Montréal that will force you inside for a libation or two with its​ hip, trendy feel and fantastic mixology.Just about every angle of Bar Henrietta oozes a certain relaxed cool factor to it. The service is on point without being pretentious, the environs​ have a modern vibe, and the ladies in the house are all dressed for a night on the town. There isn't much for you can ask for when you are looking for a pre-game warm-up​ in Montréal. Sure, it gets loud - it is a narrow building made of wood and brick after all​ - but that is a plus on a Friday's first stop after dinner (I recommend Le Serpente, by the way).They also offer an abbreviated menu that I was unable to try but I admired​ everything I witnessed passing me by. Oh, the gentlemen will probably find the women serving the libations quite easy on the eyes and the ladies will also enjoy the view behind the bar.Bar Henrietta is aces in my book.

Loved this bar. The drinks were quite good the service was very friendly and I loved the two appetizers we got. The grilled calamari with black rice and the popcorn was the best popcorn I've ever had and I love my popcorn!! The vibe is electrifying. Decor is very trendy. Great spot for a night out with friends.

Bar Henrietta is a cute spot to grab a drink and a snack on Laurier. I loved the lively energy and pretty decor (casual chic). The staff were attentive and friendly and checked on us frequently , very good customer service. I had a glass of cava (nice dry and refreshing) and my boyfriend had a dark beer. We also ordered some food from their menu. We started with the chicken liver mousse with tomato jam , it was delicious- great flavour without being overpowering and great silky smooth texture. The jam added a touch of sweetness without being too much. We also had the Portuguese bifana pork sandwich , the bread was fresh and the meat was tasty and not dry (it came with a spicy sauce on the side and pickles on the side as well). The pickles were actually excellent. The sandwich while fresh and good wasn't your authentic bifana it was more a cold cut version of it as opposed to the traditional cut of meat. We had Natas for dessert , these were good but again didn't taste traditional, still tasty and enjoyable tho ! Pricing was reasonable -mid range. This is a great place for a nice drink with a friend or with a date. Not great for big groups though since the space is very tight. Other than that I really loved this place , great choice for a nice drink and a small bite to eat in the plateau.

We got there a little late for happy hour. The place was packed, but we seated shortly. The staff is attentif and the food well balance. Good harmony of flavors and good wine selection. The place is very cosy.

I haven't eaten here since the change from Barmacie, but I did swing by after dinner recently and just loved the look and feel, the friendly service, and the affordable and dry and lovely glass of cava they had on the menu. We were able to cozy in with our friends who were already there, a kind person came and offered to tuck our coats away in the closet which made the small space feel not cramped. We were also able to order and pay promptly which helped since we were running to a show. The lighting is soft and romantic, the vibe is just right for a chill date or a friend hang with intimate overtones, or for laughs on Laurier with new friends..

This is my favourite spot to drink with friends. Their food menu is very interestin with small dishes that you can easily share with friends. Every dish stands out from each other. I love their ceviche tuna and octopus. Highly recommended

Best place in the Mile End/Plateau for drinks and small plates! The service is outstanding every. Great food menu, recommend the popcorn and grilled cheese - but all the meats are great and the oysters as well. They have a great terrace in the summer too. Great atmosphere!

I hadn't been here since it was Baldwin's barmacie. We were looking for a calm place for a drink on a Saturday night and decided to check it out.I love the look and decor - the long communal table running through one side of the place is well done. The music (authentic Latin) was great albeit a bit loud and the ambiance waa nice. There is an extensive wine list (most choices available by the bottle only) as well as a cocktail menu.Drinks were good - olives we ordered to nibble on were a tiny portion. We didn't eat but the choices looked interesting.Service was just ok - waitress was lovely and took our coats but waiters who subsequently served us were a little cold.

Beautifully decorated bar. Drinks were tasty but quite small. Very small selection of food. But good place to have a conversation. Would recommend to to others and try. Waiters are also all nice and speak but French and English; they even offer to hang your coats up in the winter.

Exquisite decor, tingling music, and above par drinks. Henrietta provides a good place to gossip with friends. The hustle and bustle doesn't take away from the great service with its ever smiling and welcoming staff. Maybe not a good choice for a first date since the high decibels can interrupt a flowy conversation.The cocktails were flavorsome, as you would expect from a decent bar. However, I think there is room to improve the originality of the beverages which explains the last missing star. PS: Taxes are included within the menu which is, I thought, a nice feature and goes along with the European concept of Henrietta.
This is literally the tastiest restaurant in Montreal with the best looking staff!

Wow...very bad...very bad. Where to begin??? Don't like the decor....service ....heuuu what service????!!!  There are no fun reasonable possibilities to accommodate 4 people....what kind of seating concept is this??? I was told that they don't take reservations ...but the place was 3/4 empty....and were told that we had to move from the only reasonable table / banquette that could accommodate us...as it was reserved at 11:00pm(????)....as we left at 10:55pm...no one, whom allegedly reserved that specific banquette, was to be seen...never mind.Cocktails: We love cocktails...None of us like any of our cocktails...dunno what to say really.Food: very decent! Carpaccio, mini octopus, grilled cheese. The popcorn, cheese etc thing...abort!! Very oily.  Nope we cannot be back...we much prefer Barmacie, on all aspects.

I wish I could say "the king is dead, long live the king", but somehow I feel Henrietta is still in search of its identity or I simply miss the bar that used to be at the same location: Barmacie. The ambiance  was nice, the music was happy, although the place became slowly noisy with the Saturday crowds. We were party of ten and the only available table for us was long and narrow with stools without back support that I find suitable for very short visits. I think what made me sad is the list of cocktails. I bothered trying the Goldeneye, which would have been a hit, if the glass wasn't full of so much ice to dilute to maximum the intended spiciness. On the other hand the Bloody Caesar was soooo spicy that my lips were burning while I was drinking it, although it was made Russian strong as per the wishes of one of my friends I wouldn't feel the vodka. Had to order another beer to wash the heat. In a matter of fact our host offered a substitute when he heard my complaint, which is in line of what a good service in a bar should be. Prices of the drinks are overall reasonable, but my less than ten olives appetizer did not deserve a five dollars charge. I hope the cocktails in Henrietta will improve over time as I would love to come back, sit at the bar with my date and write more excited review!
Thoughtful staff (especially our bartender Nadia). We had a Goldeneye and an Atlantic, I would definitely recommend both. Food was way overpriced, considering both its quality AND quantity

user_name: Yelp Was Supposed To Delete This K.
user_review: The llita was a perfect post-dinner drink (it has chartreuse ... and gin, prosecco and cucumber). The aroma of popcorn with shaved cheese, lemon and chili pepper was amazing, so I would definitely love to be here again with an appetite.

Nice ambiance, really cute patio, I enjoyed the wine and apps I tried, but this only gets 3 stars because our waiter was really bad. I tried several VERY different types of wine and he re-used my wine glass each time! This is supposed to me a wine bar, isn't it? The person I was with even said "you're re-using the same glass?" and he either didn't hear or didn't react. And then proceeded to not bus any my partner's empties. Really weird.

Two friends and I stumbled upon this place because where we intended to go was closed for a holiday. We got beer and food and everything we ordered was amazing!! 2 of us are vegetarian and the grilled cheese, cucumber feta salad, and fresh goat cheese toast were all incredible. The beers are local and so good that we almost ordered every single one on the menu. It was a small beer list but very well-selected.

This place is vey cute, great vibes to go out. Quiet but not too quiet, never too loud. Amazing cocktails, great food and very very good service.Definitely my go to place to have a bottle of wine with a few girlfriends!

It breaks my heart to see anything but a 5 star review for Bar Henrietta. We had a fabulous time and loved everything about it from the playlist, to the wine selection, to the ceviche and roasted jambon. So lovely, such a delight. It was the perfect way to begin our evening.

I used to come here before when it was Baldwin Barmacie, and Henrietta does make an impressive change in terms of the decor and ambiance of this cocktail bar. We came here mainly to try their "tapas-style" menu. As we walked in, the place was pretty packed and we were able to grab a "2 seat" table but we were 3 guests so we kinda had to squeeze in. The table is quite small. It took a while before we got to place our order and the service was horrible. The server/bartender didn't take the time to greet us, smile, or show any type of interest in what we wanted to order. We got our drinks first and I would definitely recommend a Mojito. It's served in an stainless stell glass with a snowball on top. Quite a cute concept. Our food arrived after 25 minutes and I must give them 4 stars on the food. Everything is delicious and I would recommend the ceviche, the batata and the sausage. YUMMY! We wanted to order more drinks, but no one ever came back to see if we wanted anything else/how we were doing. We ended up just grabbing the bill and leaving. The server never thanked us or showed any emotion.  I am giving 3 stars based on the crappy service we received. Other than that, it's a great place to catch up with friends and grab drinks.

Just discovered this place. Such a Great vibe and friendly staff. The cocktails were original especially the Goldeneye! I tried several plates and loved the variety and the fact that the kitchen is open late. I Will be back and this time with a date!
Extra nice. We has the clams and they were killer. Great service, they were still building the outside seating when we came in the first time. Great spot.
